{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3150938,"name":"Troy Dietz","username":"troy_dietz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/troy_dietz/{size}/135768_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T01:42:49.333Z","cooked":"

Given that we‚Äôre solidly in the era of no-bag and many teams are transitioning to a structure that involves more practice than the before times, I think it would be wise to start including cheap, 12V hour meters on robots to help with recording component failures, and serve as a metric to compare between years. For those unfamiliar, these are basically just a mechanical odometer, but rigged up to count ‚Äúpowered on time‚Äù instead.

image1365√ó1111 45 KB

I‚Äôm seeing much more discussion about drivetrain gears wearing out that I remember as a student, and teams are creeping into 3 seasons of reuse on brushless motors. It would be nice to have some slightly more concise data when failures begin to appear.
‚ÄúReplace every event‚Äù isn‚Äôt a great metric when some teams squeeze in much more time on the practice field and than others.

There will be some time inaccuracy wiring directly to a PDH circuit due to idle time, though perhaps there‚Äôs a painless way to trigger one of these to only run when the robot is enabled. I can‚Äôt think of any rule these devices would violate as the internal motor falls under ‚Äúmotors integral to a cots computing device‚Äù.

Anyway, food for thought.

andymark.com

Time-On Meter

This neat little gadget mechanically counts hours when it has power. Typically found on farm equipment for timing maintenance schedules, it can be used on robots to gauge how much time your robot has been powered across it's entire life. This can be...

Comes with a handy bracket to mount to your robot.

This actually seems to be a good idea. Could you rig this up to a relay that turns on when you enable? There is also the fancy software way of making log files.

We‚Äôre wiring ours to the switchable channel on the PDH and only applying power to it when the robot is enabled

I‚Äôm not a programmer, but having the rio write to file feels simpler, cheaper, and more accurate.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-02-23T01:54:15.669Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":64.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427787,"topic_slug":"hour-meter-on-robots","display_username":"Duncan Macdonald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6295,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"üá®üá¶"},"post_url":"/t/hour-meter-on-robots/427787/4","custom_user_title":"üá®üá¶","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150944,"name":"Troy Dietz","username":"troy_dietz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/troy_dietz/{size}/135768_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T02:03:17.516Z","cooked":"

But does that solution involve a little tiny mechanical clock?

I like having a physical, ‚Äúalways on‚Äù display for maintenance items and such because it cuts the resistance to almost nothing.

For example, a mechanical student replacing drivetrain pinions can bag them up and sharpie the hour count when the failure occurred. No booting things up and poking through rio files and etc. Eliminates the mental excuses I would make with myself.

@kgzak I am slightly judging Andymark for that pricing as I bought a half dozen of those same meters for $3 each from Aliexpress.
I also had that reimbursement denied by my college because bureaucracy, so fair enough.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-02-23T02:09:36.507Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":190,"readers_count":189,"score":128.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427787,"topic_slug":"hour-meter-on-robots","display_username":"Troy Dietz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6295,"username":"Duncan_Macdonald","name":"Duncan Macdonald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/duncan_macdonald/{size}/2042_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"‚ù§Ô∏è conflict-free COTS"},"post_url":"/t/hour-meter-on-robots/427787/5","custom_user_title":"‚ù§Ô∏è conflict-free COTS","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150948,"name":"Jen Lawrie","username":"Jen_Lawrie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jen_lawrie/{size}/111213_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T02:07:41.649Z","cooked":"

We saw one of those on 3940‚Äôs robot at the AndyMark booth at Championships, and knew we‚Äôd want one on our robot. At first, it was counting for all hours the robot was on, but my programming team made some adjustments last week so it is now only counting drive time. I‚Äôm not sure which one we really want, but our original plan was to measure driver practice. We actually haven‚Äôt gotten nearly as much of that yet as we have autonomous testing. We‚Äôre aiming to get the counter over 100 hours before our first event. Good point on watching timing for parts to wear, now I‚Äôll have my team take note of that.

IMG_84971920√ó1440 497 KB
